reviews.text: Watched this film recently, I was filled with so many different emotions. It is a very heavy film but it is important for us to remember our past and accept it so the same mistakes won't be made in a future. It is a miracle what a film company can do on a power of will and raw determination without the financial support from the government, just so the people could know and remember what their ancestors went through for them.

The film touches on historically important topics of the Kazakh steppes. Shows all the harsh truth. Each story, each frame is filled with a touching drama. Although the film looks cheap from the technical point of view, its meaning and importance is much higher.

In the western world, there is very little knowledge of the 20th century struggles that the Kazakh people suffered at the hands of the Red Army and a terrible drought, so this remarkable film is not only an absorbing epic drama but an enlightening history lesson. How wonderful that a very talented and determined Kazakh woman writer director has managed to make it in difficult circumstances without access to any European support. The film is a natural for the festival circuit and it is hoped that as many people as possible will manage to see it, enjoy it, and learn.

The film is based on the real events. This is an untold story of century old colonization of Kazakhstan. After many years of struggle, Kazakhs have been fighting for its independence for a long time. It is impossible to watch film without tears. The Kazakhs fought with the bare hands, against well-armed Russians, fought only with one strength of spirit. Such stories are certainly very impressive. Mass battle scenes are very brutal and bloody, but the scale of filming is simply amazing! The gloomy landscapes of the steppes and the delightful soundtrack complete each other. Battle scenes make you not only shudder, but also sympathize with the actors, relive the events with them! The film describes a crime against humanity, and the immoral behavior of the colonialists. The film features one of the most memorable scenes in the world cinema history, when the hungry wolves were chasing mother with her kids, the mother faces a difficult dilemma between her childrens, choice of life.

Goloschekin was well aware of the situation in the Kazakh steppes through his envoys. O. Zhandosov, who visited Sarysu district on a special assignment, gave the following information: While visiting the villages, I came across corpses that had not been buried for decades ... Women endure poverty and hunger. Men are immediately discouraged. Depressed people eat whatever they can get their hands on. The bones are collected and boiled dozens of times to connect the heart. Semi-processed hides can also be replaced by food. I met a few people who ate dog meat and did not hide it. On the way from the tenth village, I saw two teenagers from a deserted Japan. In the 5th village, a woman with heavy legs, half-swollen from hunger, approached me and asked me to shoot her with a dog.The Holoshchekin genocide left Kazakhstanis, first of all, the Kazakh people, hungry and refugees. This was the result of the Bolshevik experiment - a mother complaining, a child crying, the Kazakh steppe darkened and stinking.
